intro: Seseli tortuosum subsp. maritimum, commonly known as the coastal seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight aromatic scent. It is adapted to salt spray and is often found in dune environments along the Mediterranean coast.
